fill: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 198px; margin-left: 1980px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.p: Ethernet frames are variable in size, ranging from 64 bytes (minimum, to avoid collisions in CSMA/CD) to 1518 bytes (standard maximum, including headers). Jumbo frames can extend this to 9000+ bytes in modern networks.

switch.text: Ethernet frames are variable in size, ranging from 64 bytes (minimum, to avoid collisions in CSMA/CD) to 1518 bytes (standard maximum, including headers). Jumbo frames can extend this to 9000+ bytes in m...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 178px; margin-left: 1720px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.p:
Without VLAN.
With VLAN, MTU becomes 1522 bytes.

rect.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 0));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 118px; height: 1px; padding-top: 293px; margin-left: 141px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;

div.div: Thesea are not the part of core Ethernet frame II structure
